title: The Bank Heist Interrogation: A Race Against Time

intro.narration: In the cold, sterile confines of a government interrogation room, you find yourself cornered. Accused of a bank heist that has left the city in chaos, you must navigate a web of lies and truths to clear your name.

nodes.narration: The interrogator slams the door shut, his cold eyes piercing through you. 'Tell me everything about the robbery,' he growls.

choices.text: I don't know anything about it.
I was there, but I didn't participate.

nodes.narration: The interrogator leans forward, his expression unreadable. 'Prove it.', he says.

choices.text: I can't prove it without incriminating myself.
I can provide an alibi.

nodes.narration: You recount your alibi, a night spent at a friend's house. The interrogator studies you, his eyes never leaving yours.

choices.text: I'm telling the truth.
I'm lying.

nodes.narration: The interrogator slams his fist on the table, a look of frustration on his face. 'You're lying,' he growls.

choices.text: I'm telling the truth.
I'm not lying.

nodes.narration: You feel the pressure mounting as the interrogator continues to grill you. Every word feels like a dagger, every silence a confession.

choices.text: I'll confess to something small to make this stop.
I won't confess to anything.

nodes.narration: You stand your ground, refusing to confess to a crime you didn't commit. The interrogator's demeanor changes, his tone becoming more aggressive.

choices.text: I won't back down.
I need a break.

nodes.narration: The interrogator stands, towering over you. 'You're a liability,' he growls, before storming out of the room.

choices.text: I need to get out of here.
I should wait for my lawyer.

nodes.narration: You're left alone in the room, your heart pounding in your chest. The door swings open, and a new interrogator enters.

choices.text: I need to talk to my lawyer immediately.
I'll cooperate, but only with this new interrogator.

nodes.narration: The new interrogator offers you a deal: cooperate fully, and they'll drop the charges. But you know that to do so would mean admitting to things you didn't do.

choices.text: I'll take the deal.
I won't betray myself.
